turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: We'll take reading as we go.  If the reactor's breached or the warheads have released radioactive debris, we'll back away.  Simple.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Okay... Hippy's not going... McWhirter, you can run Little Geek.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Look, it's three AM.  These guys are running on bad coffee and four hours sleep.  You better start cutting them some slack.

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: I can't afford slack, Brigman.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Hey, you come on my rig, you don't talk to me, you start ordering my guys around.  It won't work.  You gotta know how to handle these people... we have a certain way of doing things here.

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: I'm not interested in your way of doing things. Just get your team ready to dive.

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: We'll go in through that large breach.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Let's go, guys.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Coffey, we're a little pressed for time.

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: Monk, Schoenick... secure the package.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Did you find Wilhite?

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Virgil?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: God, I hate that bitch.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Yeah, well you never should have married her then.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Just get around so your lights are on the hatch.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Check.  Then I just hang with these guys, right?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Now we're right in the middle of this big-time international incident.  Like the Cuban Missile Crisis or something.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: No, I mean it.  Those SEALs aren't telling us diddly.  Something's going on.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Hippy, you think everything's a conspiracy.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Everything is.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: That's Perry.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: That's it then.  Finler, McWhirter, Dietz, and Perry.  Jesus.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Do we just leave him there?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Yeah, for now.  Our first priority's to get something to breathe.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Come on, man.  What else could it be?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Why bring it here?

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: It's gotta be, like, an emergency plan to keep it away from the Russians... Hotwire one of the nukes with some kinda detonator, put it back in the sub, and fry the whole thing, slicker'n snot. Oh, uh... hi, Lins.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Lins, stay away from that guy.  I mean it.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Yeah.  The dude's in bad shape... you see his hands?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Go to the infirmary... get the cart .. oxygen... de-fib kit... adrenaline in a... ten cc syringe... and some... heating blankets. You got all that?

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Got it. Over.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Meet me in the moonpool.  Move fast.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Is that it?  Is this right?

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Yeah!  I mean, I don't know... it looks right.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: All right.  Do it!

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Hey, you guys are milking that job.

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: That's cause we love freezin' our butts off out here sooo much, boss.

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Triple time sounds like a lotta money, Bud.  It ain't.  I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: We're here now.  Let's get her done.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: He's convulsing!

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: It's his mixture!  Too much oxygen!

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: 'Fish'?

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Yuh?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Take the first watch in sonar.  Hippy, you handle the exterior surveillance.  One Night, see if you can get that transmitter working for me, okay?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Hafta... go on to... the moonpool.  Only way.

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: I can't... make it... podner.

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Howdy, y'all.  Hey, Lindsey!  I'll be damned! You shouldn't be down here sweet thing, ya'll might run ya stockings.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Couldn't stay away.  You running mixture for us? Good.  Couldn't ask for better.

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Okay, here we go.  Start equalizing, y'all.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Cat, you tie onto this manifold.  There's some tanks on the other side; I'm gonna go check them out.

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: You watch yourself.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: You better not say you missed that.

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Missed what?

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Y'all could be more specific.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Not us.  Not human.  Get it?  Something non- human, but intelligent...

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I think they're from 'you know'.  Some place that has similar conditions... cold, intense pressure.  No light.

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Happy as hogs in a waller down there, prob'ly.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: We should be dead.  We didn't decompress.

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Out blood oughta be fizzin' like a warm, shook- up Coke.

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Those guys ain't so tough.  I fought plenty of guys tougher'n them.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Now we get to hear about how he used to be a contender.

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Hippy, you pussy.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: What good's the money if your dick drops off in six months?

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Quiet!  Quiet!

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Turn it up, bozo.

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Are we talkin' little space friend here?

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Right on!  Hot rods of the Gods.  Right, Lins? Hey, no really!  It could be NTIs.  The CIA has known about them for years.  They abduct people all the time.  There was this woman I knew in Albuquerque who--

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: That thing was probably their version of Big Geek... like an ROV.

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Just checking is out, huh?  How come?

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: SHIT!

turns.speaker: CATFISH
turns.text: Give me that!!

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: Lady, we better fish or cut bait.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Just hold your water, okay?  So Kirkhill, we gonna do this or we gonna talk about it?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Get comfortable.  The bad news is we got six hours in this can, blowing down.  The worse news is it's gonna take us three weeks to decompress back to the surface later.

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: We've been fully briefed, Mrs. Brigman.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Don't call me that, okay... I hate that.  Alright, from now on we watch each other closely for signs of HPNS...

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: Look, we've all made chamber runs to this depth. We're checked out.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Oh... chamber runs.  Uh huh, that's good.  Well, hey... you guys know any songs?

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: Cab One, do you see it yet?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: The magnetometer is pegged.  Side-scan is showing a big return, but I don't see anything yet.  Are you sure you got the depth right on this?

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: Cab One, radiation readings?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Neutron counter's not showing very much.

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: Wilhite, anything?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Copy that, continuing forward.  You just want me to get shots of everything, right?

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: Roger, document as much as you can, but keep moving.  We're on a tight timeline.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Copy that.

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: Radiation is nominal.  The warheads must still be intact.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: How many are there?

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: 24 Trident missiles.  Eight MIRVs per missile.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: That's 192 warheads... And how powerful are they?

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: I want 'round-the-clock manning of the sonar shack and the exterior cameras.  We need early warning if the Soviet craft try another incursion.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Gimme a break!  Coffey, these things live three and a half miles down on the bottom of an abyssal trench!  Trust me... they're not speaking Russian.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: You've got some huevos bringing this... thing... into my rig!  With everything that's been going on up in the world, you bring a nuclear weapon in here?  Does this strike anyone as particularly psychotic, or is it just me?

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: You don't need to know the details of this mission... you're better off if you don't.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: You're right... I don't.  I just need to know that this thing is out of here!  You hear me, Roger Ramjet?

turns.speaker: COFFEY
turns.text: Mrs. Brigman, you're becoming a serious impediment to this mission.  I believe the stress is affecting you.  Escort her to quarters and have Monk prepare a tranquilizer.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Deepcore, Deepcore... this is Cab Three on final approach.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Gotcha, Cab Three.  Who is that?  That You, Lindsey?

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Cab Three, check.  Right behind you.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: What's you depth, Cab Three?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Going over the wall.  Coming to bearing 065. Everybody stay tight and in sight.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Figured that out for yourself, did you?

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: We got Russian subs creeping around.  Shit! Something goes wrong they could say anything happened down here, man.  Give our folks medals, know what I mean?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: A non-terrestrial intelligence.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Non-Terrestrial Intelligence.  NTIs.  Yeah, I like that better then UFOs.  Although that works too... Underwater Flying Objects.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Look, you can just punch into his little chip where you want him to go, and he goes, right?

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Well, yeah, but the tether off it ain't gonna be fancy.  When he gets down there he'll just sit, like a dumb-shit.  Unless something wanders through view of the camera, you'll get nada.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Let's go for it.  We could get lucky.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: No.  Just you and me.  We get some proof, then tell them.  Hippy, look... if was can prove to Coffey it's not Russians, maybe he'll ease off the button a little.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: I gotta tell you, that guy scares me a lot more than whatever's down there.  A.J. Squared Away goddamn jarhead robot.  Okay, gimme a couple hours on this.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Schoenick... your Lieutenant is about to make a real bad career move...

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: That guy's crazier'n a shithouse rat!

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: He can't get to the door... I think he's going to try and take him himself.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: He couldn't be that dumb.  The guy's a trained killer.  Bud's idea of a fight is arm-wrestling One Night over laundry duty.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: 12000 feet.  Jesus, I don't believe he's doing this.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Shut up, Hippy.  Bud, how you doing?

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Uh, oh...

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: What kind of luminous things, Bud?

turns.speaker: MONK
turns.text: Fluid breathing system.  We just got them.  We use it if we need to go really deep.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: How deep?

turns.speaker: MONK
turns.text: Deep.  It's classified... you know.  Anyway, you breathe liquid, so you can't be compressed. Pressure doesn't get to you.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Hey!

turns.speaker: MONK
turns.text: Check this out.

turns.speaker: MONK
turns.text: Stand by on the ROV.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: Perry, stand by on the ROV.  Sorry about this, little buddy.  Better you than me, know what I mean?

turns.speaker: MONK
turns.text: Getting a reading?

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: It's twitching but it's below the line you said was safe.

turns.speaker: HIPPY
turns.text: You boss is having a full-on meltdown.  Guy's fixing to pull the pin on fifty kilotons and we're all ringside!

turns.speaker: MONK
turns.text: What's the timer set for?

turns.speaker: MONK
turns.text: High-Pressure Nervous Syndrome.  Muscle tremors, usually in the hands first.  Nausea, increased excitability, disorientation.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Very good.  About one person in twenty just can't handle it.  They go buggo.  They're no way to predict who's susceptible, so stay alert.

turns.speaker: MONK
turns.text: 4800 feet.  It's official.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Bud, according to Monk here, you just set a record for the deepest suit dive.  Bet you didn't think you'd be doing this when you got up this morning.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: 8500 feet, Bud.  Everything okay?

turns.speaker: MONK
turns.text: Ask him a pressure effects.  Tremors, vision problems, euphoria.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Ensign Monk want to know how you feel.

turns.speaker: MONK
turns.text: He's losing it.  Talk to him.  Keep him with us.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Bud, it's the pressure.  Try to concentrate. Concentrate on my voice.  Just listen to my voice.

turns.speaker: MONK
turns.text: He can still make it.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I know how alone you feel... alone in all that cold blackness... but I'm there in the dark with you, Bud you're not alone...

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: What kind of light?

turns.speaker: MONK
turns.text: He's hallucinating badly.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Would we see the flash?

turns.speaker: MONK
turns.text: Through three miles of water?   I don't know.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: But your friend is waiting downstairs.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: She'll wait.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: When do you have to go back?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I don't know... It depends on Ettore... He's now in the process of negotiating for a contract here in Sicily...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Then how come you're not with him?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: What a question... Because I want to be with you, naturally. I hope he doesn't close the deal so he'll leave me alone at least for a few days... Isn't this water wonderful!

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I'd like to find a place where I can get some peace and rest, maybe around here somewhere. I'd like to try...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: What could be more restful than this?...  Excuse me, what is it that you want to try?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Fine. Can't you see so yourself?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Anna... Maybe it would be better to wait a while.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Wait for what?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Sandro... A month is too long a time. I have become used to being without you.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: You'll get over it soon. It's the usual anxiety.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: A little more so this time.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: So, it will just take you a little longer to get over it.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: But I think we should talk about it. Or are you fully convinced that we too won't understand each other?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: There will be plenty of time to talk about it later.  We'll  get married  soon.  That way we'll have more time...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: In this case, getting married means nothing. Aren't we already the same as being married? And Corrado and Giulia -- aren't they already the same as being married?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: But why rattle your brains by arguing and talking... Believe me, Anna, words never help at all. They only serve to confuse. I love you, Anna. Isn't I that enough?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No. It's not enough... I told you before that I would like to get away for a while and be alone.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: But you just said that a month was too...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I mean, to stay away longer -- two months... a year... three years... Yes, I know, it sounds absurd. And I feel awful. The very idea of losing you makes me want to die... And yet... I... I just don't have the same feeling for you any more.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: And what about yesterday... at my house... didn't you have any feeling for me, even then?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: There you go... Must you always spoil everything!

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: But where are you going?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I'm thirsty.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: If I had a man waiting for me for half an hour and whom I hadn't seen for a month ...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You know, I could just as well go without seeing him today.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: What! After giving us such a run around...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Did you sleep well?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Yes, fairly well. But I went to bed last night planning to do some thinking about a number of things ... instead, I fell asleep.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I didn't know one could sleep so well on a yacht. It lulls you ...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Which one shall I wear?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: This one is gorgeous.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Then why don't you try it on?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Claudia, aren't you coming?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I'm certainly not going to swim across.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: We'll send the raft back to you.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Isn't it fashionable any more to put on a sailor's cap with the name of the yacht?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No, Dad, it isn't.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: And how long will you be away?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Four or five days.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Oh, very well. I'll just spend the weekend alone by myself and take a little rest. I should be used to it by now.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Used to what?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: To the fact of my retirement, not only as a diplomat but also as a father.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: But how could you say such a thing?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Because it's true. After thirty years -- not having ever spoken the truth to anyone, I should at least allow myself to do so with my own daughter.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: And have you any other truths to tell me?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: You already know what they are.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You mean Sandro, don't you?  Well, I beg of you, please, spare me that. Goodbye, Dad.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Up until now, Dad, I've been the one who hasn't wanted to marry him.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: It's the same thing. Goodbye, dear.

turns.speaker: ANNA'S FATHER
turns.text: I presume by this method that you'll be able to uncover some new clue, either a handkerchief or an article of clothing... In other words, something which your men have not been able to find as yet.

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: Without any doubt, sir. If anything belonging to the girl who has run away is still here on this island...

turns.speaker: ANNA'S FATHER
turns.text: Allow me to inform you that my daughter is not a fugitive.

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: I'm sorry, sir. I didn't mean to put it that way. But, you must understand, sir, that I...

turns.speaker: ANNA'S FATHER
turns.text: I understand very well. Only I don't want any rash assumptions to be made.

turns.speaker: ANNA'S FATHER
turns.text: This looks to me like a good sign. Don't you think so? As far as I'm concerned, anyone who reads the Bible could not have committed an act of impropriety. Why... as a matter of fact, I remember when I was in China, many years ago, I happened to be involved in a similar situation, concerning an English woman, the wife of Ambassador Shafford, a good friend of mine. There, too, we found a Bible... And I said at the time that whatever had happened, that clue alone had definitely ruled out the possibility of... suicide. Why, it was logical, I said, that whoever reads the Bible believes in God and therefore...  No? You don't believe it? Well, as a matter of fact, I was right... The woman was found two days later. It was a case of amnesia.

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: Sir, if you have no objections, may we start the search?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: It's already two hours... What are we going to do?

turns.speaker: CARABINIERE
turns.text: It takes about twenty to twenty-two hours for the current to reach here from Lisca Bianca.

turns.speaker: CARABINIERE
turns.text: These people are contemptible. They have no sense of dignity at all.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: And you say that came from Lisca Bianca?

turns.speaker: CARABINIERE
turns.text: It couldn't have come from anywhere else. At least, somewhere from that vicinity... But I really can't understand it. Contraband cigarettes on that island! It's the first time that ever happened.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Look... I'd like to get back to Lisca Bianca.

turns.speaker: CARABINIERE
turns.text: But how could we...at a time like this when we just... well, let's at least first have a look around the other islands. Could be that something might turn up there.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: But even here we were supposed to find who knows what... And all we bring back with us is a crate of cigarettes.

turns.speaker: CARABINIERE
turns.text: As you wish.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: What is that one over there called?

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: That must be Basiluzzo.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Sounds like the name of a fish -- merluzzo, basiluzzo...

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Say, Claudia, wouldn't you like to climb up with me and take a look over there?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: At what?

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: At the ruins. They're very ancient, you know.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Well, what?

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Have you decided?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: All I said was that it sounds like a good idea.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: How wonderful!

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: That's Patrizia's way of letting us know she's with us.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I think you're very sweet, Corrado.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: More so than the shark?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: There's no comparison.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Then why don't we go up and see the ruins?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Somebody must live here!

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: But Anna wouldn't be staying with the kind of people who live here.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Really! Still, it remains to be seen why she invented a shark. What was her purpose in that?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Maybe you'd better ask him.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: What were you and Anna arguing about?... Excuse me for being so indiscreet, but this is serious...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I have a feeling that you're not used to being alone.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: That seems to apply to you also...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Don't be so humble.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: How should I be ... arrogant?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: But of course... arrogant, haughty... Hasn't Anna ever told you?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: There's nothing much to laugh at.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: And that's what I say, too. We could have all been killed.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Shall we go for a swim?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Oh, no... please... not here.  It looks too dangerous.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Twelve years ... But why haven't they married?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: And why haven't they left each other?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I'm beginning to have my doubts. It couldn't be that they're in love?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Could be. They're the kind of people who are capable of anything.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Find anything?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: As far as I'm concerned, I think she's alive... Why, even this morning... that business about the shark... it wasn't at all true.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: And why do you tell us this only now?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I... I don't know... I didn't think it was worthwhile... She was laughing over it...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Nothing but the usual argument... The only thing was -- if I remember correctly -- that she said she had a need to be alone.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: And how do you explain that?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Nothing... nothing at all!

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: But why don't you tell him?  A girl who was with us has disappeared.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: And I suppose it's my fault... Why don't you tell him that too. That's what you believe, isn't it?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Rather than being so occupied with my thoughts, you would have been better off trying to understand what Anna was thinking.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Are you feeling better?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I'm sorry about last night. Please forgive me.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: You're very fond of Anna, aren't you?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Yes, very much so.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Has she ever spoken to you about me?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Occasionally, but always with affection.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: And yet, she seemed to feel that our love for her -- mine, yours, even her father's, in a certain sense -- weren't enough for her, or didn't mean much to her.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I know. I keep asking myself what I could have done to prevent all this from happening.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I think that you might go and have a look yourself.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Yes, maybe that is better.
